page.title: 12A DAY IN MY LIFE...
page.content: infants. In the infant school there are five classes and in the junior school there are nine classes two of which are "Special Classes". The schools have a catchment area which extends from Edwardsville in the North to Fiddlers Elbow in the South. -------------------------------------- A typical day in my school life. ----------------------------------- A typical day in my school life begins at seven thirty a.m. when I rise and have breakfast of either cereals or a piece of toast and coffee. My mother has already gone to work then because she leaves at seven thirty a.m. At eight a.m. I go upstairs and get dressed and I come back downstairs and watch the television. At eight forty I go down to the bus stop and the bus comes at eight fifty. I arrive at school at nine a.m. The whistle to
